newsitem.title: USA: Commercial Intertech sees strong Q4 results.
newsitem.headline: Commercial Intertech sees strong Q4 results.

text.p: Commercial Intertech Corp said Wednesday it foresaw strong fourth-quarter results for itself and its subsidiary, CUNO Inc.
"We remain optimistic that both Commercial Intertech and CUNO Incorporated will report strong fourth-quarter results," it said.
Commercial Intertech, a multinational company with 27 manufacturing plants in eight countries, makes metal products as well as hydraulic and building systems.
CUNO, with eight plants in six countries, makes filtration and purification systems to remove contaminants from gases and fluids like water.
Commercial Intertech said it expected its operating income to be the same this year as it was in 1995.
Net income would be "somewhat" lower than last year due to higher tax rates and interest expenses, it added.
The company said it expected fourth quarter and fiscal year operating income for Astron Building Systems to exceed by "a wide margin" the amount it reported for the same period last year.
"Business conditions remain relatively strong for Astron," it said.
The company said it foresaw U.S. Metal Stamping units improving their performance.
"We believe full-year performance should approximate the strong results posted last year," it said.
The company said Hydraulic Systems was expecting a better fourth quarter as it began to receive more bookings.
"Operating income for the fourth quarter will exceed income for the same 1995 period," it said. "For the full-year, Hydraulic Systems peformance should be near the record level achieved in 1995."
